thread.title: Syrian general: Russian strikes helping ground offensive
thread.title_full: Syrian general: Russian strikes helping ground offensive - US News

author: USNews
title: Syrian general: Russian strikes helping ground offensive
text:
Syrian chief of staff: Russian strikes helping new ground offensive to eliminate 'terrorists' In this photo made from the footage taken from Russian Defense Ministry official web site, Wednesday, Oct. 7, 2015, a Russian navy ship launches a cruise missile in the Caspian Sea. Russia's Defense Minister Sergei Shoigu said four Russian navy ships in the Caspian launched 26 cruise missiles at Islamic State targets in Syria.(Russian Defense Ministry Press Service via AP)
Associated Press Oct. 8, 2015 | 4:43 a.m. EDT + More DAMASCUS, Syria (AP) â€” Syria's chief-of-staff has declared a wide-ranging ground offensive by Syrian troops, a day after government forces advanced in a multipronged attack backed by Russian airstrikes and cruise missiles launched from the Caspian Sea.
Gen. Ali Ayoub says the Russian strikes have facilitated an expanded military operation to eliminate "terrorists." The Syrian government refers to all armed opposition against President Bashar Assad as terrorists.
Syrian activists said government troops pushed Thursday into rural parts of Latakia province.
Activist Ahmad al-Ahmad said on Wednesday, fighting that focused on rural Hama and Idlib province in northwest sparked intense clashes, with rebels repelling government troops from at least one village.
Meanwhile, the Britain-based Syrian Observatory for Human Rights said Russian airstrikes in Idlib killed at least seven civilians on Wednesday.
